data.title: Fayard Nicholas
data.text:
AKA Fayard Antonio Nicholas

Born: 20-Oct-1914

Birthplace: Mobile, AL

Died: 24-Jan-2006

Location of death: Burbank, CA

Cause of death: Pneumonia

Remains: Buried, Pierce Brothers Valhalla Memorial Park, North Hollywood, CA

Gender: Male

Religion: Bahai

Race or Ethnicity: Black

Sexual orientation: Straight

Occupation: Dancer

Nationality: United States

Executive summary: Tapdancer, The Nicholas Brothers

One of the greatest tapdancers of all time.

Brother: Harold Nicholas (tap dancer)

Wife: Geraldine Pate (div. 1941, two children)

Wife: Barbara January (m. 1967, d. 1998, one child)

Tony 1989 for Black and Blue (best choreography)

Hollywood Walk of Fame 7083 Hollywood Blvd. (shared with brother)

Black Filmmakers Hall of Fame

Stroke

FILMOGRAPHY AS ACTOR

Broadway: The Golden Age (Apr-2003) · Himself

Night at the Golden Eagle (26-Apr-2002)

The Liberation of L. B. Jones (18-Mar-1970)

The Pirate (20-May-1948) · Specialty Dance

Stormy Weather (17-Nov-1943) · Himself

The Great American Broadcast (9-May-1941)

Tin Pan Alley (22-Nov-1940) · Dance Specialty

Down Argentine Way (11-Oct-1940) · Specialty Act

The Big Broadcast of 1936 (20-Sep-1935)

New!
